properties.Title: Storm Surge Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Coastal flood warning issued jointly by Fisheries and Oceans Canada (Science) and the Meteorological Service of Canada - Quebec Region on 6 May 2020. Higher than normal water levels combined with the current run of high-amplitude tidal ranges could result in minor flooding along the coast in the vicinity of the following locality on the dates and at the times specified (Eastern Daylight Time). Quebec City: 2020-05-07, from 06:00 AM to 08:00 AM. Quebec City: 2020-05-08, from 06:30 AM to 08:30 AM. Quebec City: 2020-05-09, from 07:30 AM to 09:30 AM. Quebec City: 2020-05-10, from 08:00 AM to 10:00 AM. ### Coastal erosion is possible in vulnerable areas. Storm surge warnings are issued when water levels pose a threat to coastal regions. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-07T06:45:49-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-06T14:46:49-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4269460983.2020
Area: Québec area, Côte-de-Beaupré - L'Île d'Orléans area, Bellechasse area, Lévis area
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Update For The Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory For The Hamlet Of Livelong In The R.m. Of Mervin No. 499
properties.Summary:
Description: Update for the Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory that was issued for the Hamlet of Livelong. This advisory is for the entire hamlet and for any individuals who may access water from the Livelong water system. This advisory has been extended until May 12, 2020.
Expires: 2020-05-12T15:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Turtleford and RM of Mervin, 2020-05-05T15:51:25-06:00, B81EC94C-E64C-E72D-6FB5-FF5D1815082C
Area: R.M. of Mervin No. 499
properties.Author: SK Turtleford and RM of Mervin

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow, at times heavy, is expected. Locations: the TLH through Eagle River to Cartwright and vicinity. Time span: ending this afternoon. Remarks: The snow will change to showers or drizzle this afternoon. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Road closures are possible. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-05-06T19:59:14-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-06T13:29:14-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1945665114.2020
Area: Cartwright to Black Tickle, Eagle River
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory Alert Is Being Issued By The Resort Village Of Manitou Beach
properties.Summary:
Description: Effective immediately a precautionary Drinking Water Advisory Alert is being issued by the Resort Village of Manitou Beach. The advisory is for the entire Resort Village of Manitou Beach and any individuals who may access water from the Resort Village of Manitou beach system. This includes the Watrous South Rural Water Utility. This advisory is in effect until further notice.
Expires: 2020-05-11T17:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre, 2020-05-05T09:51:55-06:00, 83427B56-3BA3-7809-E446-6A44F747CCFF
Area: Resort Village of Manitou Beach
properties.Author: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Wet heavy snow tonight and Wednesday. Total snowfall: 10 to 15 cm or more over the Highlands. Maximum wind gusts: 70 km/h. Locations: northern Cape Breton Island. Higher elevations are most at risk for highest snowfall amounts. Time span: into Wednesday afternoon. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-06T17:45:09-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-06T01:46:09-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1863509859.2020
Area: Inverness County - Mabou and north, Victoria County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Temperatures will drop to near or below the freezing mark overnight tonight. In addition, the relatively cool weather for this time of the year will last several more days. As a result, the frost advisory for Southwestern Quebec may be maintained for all nights and mornings through the rest of this week, possibly through Sunday morning. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-07T00:28:31-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-06T08:29:31-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2175605539.2020
